Its primary role, based on the available information, seems to involve gathering and relaying information about Cuban exiles and their activities, particularly those related to anti-Castro movements and potential actions against the Cuban government. The documents suggest that the British Service was actively monitoring and reporting on the activities and opinions of key figures within the Cuban exile community, providing insights into their plans and perspectives.
